Title: Pope decries lack of political will on climate change
Summary: Pope Leo XIV urged ‘concrete actions’ on climate change . He complained that some leaders lacked the will to act . The Vatican released the American pope’s address on the sidelines of the COP30 summit .

Title: Kebbi, Zamfara Attacks: This is not the Nigeria we should accept, says Obi
Summary: Peter Obi has condemned the latest attacks in Kebbi and Zamfara states, describing the repeated violence across parts of the country as “devastating and unacceptable losses” Yesterday, gunmen reportedly attacked the Government. Yesterday, the attacks reportedly took place in the capital Abuja .

Title: Insecurity: Stop ‘naming and shaming’ us, Nigeria tells int’l community
Summary: Nigeria has urged the international community to refrain from what it called ‘naming and shaming” the country over the security challenges currently confronting it . The Chargé d’Affaires, Permanent Mission of Nigeria to the UN, Mr Syndoph Endoni, made the remarks .

Title: Nigeria, UN sign pact on elections, political stability
Summary: Nigeria and the United Nations have signed a new Regional Partnership for Democracy (RPD) A framework aimed at improving elections, addressing political instability and strengthening democratic institutions across West Africa . Speaking yesterday at the signing ceremony in Abuja, the UN said the pact was signed by both countries .

Title: PBAN laments yearly importation of 4.8 million tonnes of wheat
Summary: Premium Breadmakers Association of Nigeria (PBAN) raises fresh concerns over the country’s dependence on wheat imports . Nigeria brings in more than 4.8 million metric tonnes of wheat every year to the country . PBAN laments yearly importation of 4.9 million metric tons of wheat .

Title: PDP: Turaki seeks police protection as factions fight over national secretariat
Summary: Turaki seeks police protection as factions fight over national secretariat . He told newsmen that all the party stakeholders and organs, including governors, BoT members, and founding fathers, were already invited .

Title: Trump hosts Saudi prince for first time since Khashoggi killing
Summary: Trump expected to roll out the red carpet for the prince with a fly-by, gun salute and a gala dinner . Trump is expected to give the Saudi prince the equivalent of a state dinner .

Title: Politicians, journalists scamper for safety as police fire teargas at PDP headquarters
Summary: There was pandemonium at the national headquarters of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Abuja . Clashing supporters of rival party factions were dispersed by police . Politicians, journalists scamper for safety as police fire teargas at PDP headquarters .

Title: ‘The pitch never lies’ – Esther Okoronkwo reacts after CAF award snub
Summary: Esther Okoronkwo was left out of the final shortlist for the CAF Women’s Player of the Year Award . Super Falcons forward insists that true recognition comes from performances on the field .

Title: ASUU warns of nationwide varsity shutdown as negotiation stalls
Summary: ASUU warns of nationwide varsity shutdown as negotiation stalls . The suspension of the strike in October was meant to create an enabling environment and gesture of goodwill toward Nigerians .

Title: C'River gov dissolves LG service commission board
'I acted irresponsibly,' VeryDarkMan apologises after brawl with Mr Jollof
Comedian Mr Jollof apologises after brawl with VDM on flight
Anti-Turaki protesters storm PDP headquarters as Wike faction takes over
